reviewText: A fun little 10$ turn based stratagy with some interesting mechanics, such as moving and shooting, flanking, and terrain effects. Reminds me of my first gaming days surfing the web and finding things like flash games such as Warfair 1917 and 1944. Good tutorial and lots of campaigns. A very solid game with a good price tag for what you're getting. Almost a rarity these days with 60$ titles releasing with huge amounts of bugs.
voteText: 37 of 46 people (80%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: What it is:  Addictive fun, fast, easy to learn WW2 hex and counter" turn based wargame.\n\nSo I was hesitant to purchase this game as had its origins as an iOs game .  I chatted a bit with one of the devs online and wfound out this was not a straight port but a rework.  For 10 bucks
date: I figured what the heck.  I am very happy I gave it a shot.\n\nWhat it has:  A very well done UI
recommended: quite easy to understand and friendly.  Nice graphics.  When I started in the tutorial I was reminded of the classic Panzer/Allied General games.  The tutorials are very well done and teach you everything you need to know to play well.\n\nA ton of content comes with the game.  Over 9 separate campaigns
hoursPlayed: each with multiple missions.  3 levels of AI make the challenge customizable for all player levels.  If you are a wargames expert and want a human opponent
voteText: there is a 2 player hotseat mode with 10+ scenarios as well.\n\nThe game play is fast
helpfulPercent: clean and easy to understand.  Your units can move and attack (think soldiers and tanks firing on the move) wuth a reduction in their combat effectivness.  Cover and terrain are very important for protection and line of sight as the map is shrouded (fog of war).\n\nOverall impressions:  I really like this game!  I started it up and when I looked up
votesHelpful: 2 hours had gone by and I was still having a great time.  One of the first games in a long time that I was disappointed when life interferred and I had to stop playing.\n\nDo yourself a favor
votesTotal: get this gem of a game.  I know the devs are working on a American Civil War game as well and I am really looking forward to that one as well.\n"

reviewText: Not amazing but not bad for the price and suprisingly addictive and very easy to pick up.  But yes it's an Ipad port so not overly complex.

reviewText: Nice little game. Personally glad more mobile games are being ported. It's limitations are acceptable to me, given the fact it was written for a phone, tablet, or other lost-down-the-back-of-the-sofa" device."

reviewText: UNPLAYABLE! This game was obviously never properly tested for Windows 7, because after downloading it from Steam, the game will not launch! Tech Support from Scotland where this game originates from is as useless as ♥♥♥♥ on a Haggas. The only feedback received from another sucker who purchased this app only mess was 'are you using two monitors?' Not worth 10 cents in it's current condition. Let alone 10 Dollars!
